title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 701.10 - Adjournment of hearing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 701.10 - Adjournment of hearing

State Regulations
(a) A
hearing officer may adjourn a proceeding upon a showing of good cause and upon
a request made to the hearing officer at least fourteen days prior to the
scheduled date of the hearing. In such event, the hearing officer shall explain
to the parties the reason for such adjournment. No case shall be delayed
unreasonably. (b) Such request
shall be in writing and set forth the reasons therefor, and the position of the
other party or parties and offer alternative hearing dates. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
701.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
